name: Input
description: Input component for text input fields. This component replaces Material UI's TextField component with custom styling that matches the Syncrofy design system. It provides enhanced label formatting for required fields and custom error display with icons.

props.name: onChange
props.description: Callback fired when the value changes

props.name: disabled
props.description: If true, the input is disabled

props.name: required
props.description: If true, the input is required. When true, the label will display "(required) *" format

props.name: error
props.description: If true, the input will be in an error state. When true, displays error icon and styles helper text in red

props.name: helperText
props.description: Helper text displayed below the input. Displays with error icon if error prop is true

props.name: multiline
props.description: If true, the input will be multiline (textarea)

props.name: rows
props.description: Number of rows to display when multiline option is set

examples.title: Default
examples.code:
import { Input } from '@/components';

<Input label="Label" placeholder="Enter text" variant="outlined" />

examples.title: Required
examples.description: Required input field with formatted label
examples.code:
import { Input } from '@/components';

<Input label="Email" required variant="outlined" />

examples.title: Error State
examples.description: Input with error state and custom error icon
examples.code:
import { Input } from '@/components';

<Input 
  label="Email" 
  error 
  helperText="Invalid email address" 
  variant="outlined" 
/>

examples.title: Multiline
examples.code:
import { Input } from '@/components';

<Input 
  label="Comments" 
  multiline 
  rows={4} 
  placeholder="Enter your comments here" 
  variant="outlined" 
/>

migrationExamples.description: Replace MUI TextField with design system Input

accessibility.screenReaderNotes: Label association, error messages, and required state are announced to screen readers

whenToUse: Email, password, number, and other input types
whenNotToUse: For password inputs with show/hide toggle (use PasswordInput instead)
For search functionality (use Search component instead)
bestPractices: Always provide a label for accessibility
Use error prop and helperText together for error states
Use required prop for required fields
commonPatterns: Controlled inputs with value and onChange
